==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|ぼん|にん}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=ぼんじん}} compound {{m|zh|凡人|tr=bjom nyin}}. Compare modern {{etyl|hak|-}} reading ''fàm-ngìn''.

The [[呉音#Japanese|goon]], so likely the initial borrowing.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|ぼんにん|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ぼんにん}}

# an [[ordinary]] [[person]]
# a [[commoner]], someone who is not [[nobility]]

=====Usage notes=====
This reading appears to be somewhat less common than ''bonjin'' below.

The {{m|en|ordinary}} sense of this term is somewhat negative, with overtones of {{m|en|mediocre}}, {{m|en|unremarkable}}, {{m|en|lackluster}}.

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|ordinary person}} {{ja-r|凡人|ぼんじん}} {{qualifier|see below}}; {{ja-r|凡夫|ぼんぶ}} {{qualifier|Buddhist overtones; used more in writing}}
* {{sense|commoner}} {{ja-r|平民|へいみん}}: a commoner; {{ja-r|臣下|しんか}}: a commoner, a [[subject]]

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|ぼん|じん}}
Shift in pronunciation from ''bonnin'' above, using the [[漢音#Japanese|kan'on]] reading of ''jin'' for {{m|ja|人}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|ぼんじん|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ぼんじん}}

# an [[ordinary]] [[person]]
# a [[commoner]], someone who is not [[nobility]]

=====Usage notes=====
This appears to be the more common reading.

The {{m|en|ordinary}} sense of this term is somewhat negative, with overtones of {{m|en|mediocre}}, {{m|en|unremarkable}}, {{m|en|lackluster}}.

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|ordinary person}} {{ja-r|凡人|ぼんにん}} {{qualifier|see above}}; {{ja-r|凡夫|ぼんぶ}} {{qualifier|Buddhist overtones; used more in writing}}
* {{sense|commoner}} {{ja-r|平民|へいみん}}: a commoner; {{ja-r|臣下|しんか}}: a commoner, a [[subject]]

=====Antonyms=====
* {{sense|ordinary person}} {{ja-r|偉人|いじん}}: a [[magnificent]] person

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|はん|じん}}
Shift in pronunciation from ''bonnin'' or ''bonjin'' above, using the [[漢音#Japanese|kan'on]] reading for both characters.

This reading appears in use by the {{m|ja|有職家|tr=yūsokuka||people well acquainted with the rites and ceremonies of the imperial court and nobility}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|はんじん}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|はんじん}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=はんじん|rare|possibly|_|obsolete}} an [[ordinary]] [[person]], a [[commoner]]

=====Usage notes=====
The ''hanjin'' reading is the least common.
